posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
OK, let me just say a couple of things:

An unarmed Monk is completely different than a Kama Monk, because Unarmed requires at least 16 levels of Monk for maximum damage with the fists, which is lower for Halflings because of the small size. A Kama Monk can have as little as 2 levels and have pretty much the same effectiveness as a Monk with 20 levels except for not getting free IKD, and all the Monk immunities and speed bonus.

As for Blackguard, unfortunately, the class isn't of much use past 4 levels because everything it gives you can get better with other classes. But with 4 levels you can get Divine Might and Divine Shield, which gives you more damage and AC as long as you have Charisma. So are you looking to go heavy on BG for RP reasons or will 4 levels suffice?

I could suggest a dex-based Monk BG SD wielding Kamas. Monk 9 SD 5 BG 16 would allow you to get Epic Dodge. You'd have HiPS to get away if things get ugly and a few Sneak Attack dice (and maybe an Epic Fiendish Servant to help generate sneaks) and full attack Schedule if you go Monk 8 SD 4 BG 8 pre-epic. Let me try to build this guy quickly, but let me tell you that this build wouldn't work unarmed because of the aforementioned need to have at least 16 Monk levels for maximum effectiveness.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Monk and BG are a bit awkward to combine effectively since many abilities become important.
I have a completely different approach than Max here, a strength based build, and use monk only to get evasion, improved evasion, IKD, access to skills and a base class to build with before BG becomes available.
The build is played in full plate and needs an extra source of Dexterity for +2 to AC, or you can move points from Constitution to Dexterity if Constitution is easier to get on items where you play. Wisdom 14 is because you get access to bonus spells that way on Amia. You can also pick Bastard sword or Katana for weapon focus if you want shield AC and the magical properties you can get on a shield. The disarm success will be a little lower though.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Mick, if you went Fighter 4 BG 16 Monk 10 you'd be able to have access to WS / EWS. You wouldn't get more AC because you're forfeiting Monk AC, but +6 damage is always nice, question becomes, what do you drop for it? I'm torn between Toughness and Power Attack or the Disarm feats. As is I'd probably drop Toughness and Power Attack, moving Blind Fight to lvl 1.

EDIT: just saw you need to drop EPIC feats. Damn, having second thoughts already. What about Monk 6 Fighter 8 BG 16? That way you could get WS and EWS through bonus feats at the cost of Improved Evasion and 30% movespeed.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
With only 4 fighter levels, I'd have to drop 2 epic feats to get WS+EWS: WS on a general epic feat and EWS on the fighter bonus feat that I get in exchange for an epic BG feat.

Edit: The character loses many monk abilities already since it is supposed to wear armor (and shield if you want). Fighter is there to fill the gap between Monk 8 and BG 10 without losing BAB. The two extra feats are just a bonus.
Taking enough fighter to get EWS without giving up another epic feat would be possible with M6 F8 BG16 (M6 F4 BG10 pre epic), but then there is no room for any Monk during epic levels. If you want a Monk level in epic to be able to have a skill dump, you need to go M7 F10 BG13. Then you give up 2d6 SA and Improved evasion for EWS

Edit edit: M5 F5 BG10 pre epic will give room for a monk skill dump in epic levels, 16 BG levels and 2 fighter feats in epic levels, but KD/IKD will come very late
